sponsor.partnerMessage: Since 1957, Underwoods has been committed to quality and value. Named "Coolest Store in America" by InStore Magazine, and winner of state, national, and international design awards, Underwoods' dedication to craftsmanship and design excellence creates timeless jewelry.

posts.title: A Christmas Carol On Stage At TheatreSquared All Month Long
posts.content:
The holiday classic, A Christmas Carol, will perform at TheatreSquared all December long, with opening night tonight at 7p. 

  • Hard to miss: There are showings scheduled every day in December except Mondays, so you'd have to be a real Scrooge to miss it.  
  • Classic: Based on the novel by Charles Dickens, the play follows Ebenezer Scrooge, who receives a visit from the ghosts of Christmas past, present, and future and recovers the true spirit of Christmas. 

Get tickets for the show HERE.

posts.title: Fayetteville To Host USA Triathlon National Championship Races
posts.content:
USA Triathlon announced Fayetteville as the host of four national championship races – Off-Road Triathlon and Duathlon and Gravel Triathlon and Duathlon – during the 2023 Ozark Valley Triathlon weekend, June 2-4. 

  • Worldwide: The top 18 finishers in each age group of the off-road triathlon and duathlon will have the opportunity to represent Team USA in the 2024 World Triathlon Cross Triathlon and Duathlon World Championships to be held in Australia. 
  • Sign on up: Registration for all events opens today at 8a. National championship races are open registration, so pre-qualifying is not required.

Find more details about the event HERE.

posts.title: The Rogers Christmas Parade Will Roll Through Downtown This Friday
posts.content:
The Rogers Christmas Parade is this Friday, Dec 2, beginning at 7p and weaving through the vibrant holiday atmosphere of historic Downtown Rogers. 

  • The Nutcracker Suite: The festivities kick off with a holiday dance production by Ballet Westside Dance Studio at 6p at S. 1st St. and West Elm in the Turntable Plaza of Railyard Plaza.
  • Warm and cozy: Enjoy refreshments from the various Downtown shops and stop by The Optimist Club of Rogers at 600 W Walnut St. for some free hot cocoa.  

Find more information and a map of the parade route HERE.

posts.title: Springdale-Based Latin Music Artists Win National Award
posts.content:
Local artists Julieta Ortiz and Azucena Garcia, who make up the Duo Divinas, were presented an award at the Latin Music Awards in Chicago. 

  • And the winner is: The duo's song, Esclavos del Pecado, earned them a nomination for Singer of the Year in the Tropical Fusion category at the Latin Music Awards, the award they went on to win! 
  • Celebrating culture: Duo Divinas writes and performs songs in Bachata, a genre representative of the Dominican Republic, as well as other cultural fusions.

Listen to the KUAF interview with Duo Divinas HERE.

posts.title: Eureka Springs Welcomes All Home For The Holidays
posts.content:
Join the free, family-friendly fun at the Auditorium in Eureka Springs for the Home for the Holidays series on Dec 2 at 8:30p and Dec 9 at 7:30p. 

  • Variety show: Featuring singing, dancing, and theatre performances; each show will include a lineup of local and regional artists of all genres. 
  • The night is young: The first night of Home for the Holidays on Dec 2 will immediately follow the Eureka Springs Christmas Parade of Lights.  

Find more information HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Restful retreat: Kandler Shadow Ranch is the perfect getaway for outdoor enthusiasts looking to enjoy the excitement and beauty of Northwest Arkansas. Book your stay at the 40-acre ranch HERE.*
  • Deck the halls: Sponsor an ornament to decorate First National Bank of NWA's Tree of Hope and help raise funds to serve children affected by abuse across Northwest Arkansas.* 
  • Cool teacher: Derek Ratchford, a teacher at Sonora Middle School in Springdale, was invited to become a Grosvenor Teacher Fellow and travel to the Galapagos Islands to write lessons for National Geographic. 
  • Rolling on: Ozark Regional Transit received a $135,789 grant from the Walton Family Foundation to extend its zero-fare program through 2023.
  • Let's talk: Interested in advertising in the newsletter? Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
